item.title: VERGE 2022
item.description:
How A New Currency Could Help Solve the Climate Crisis

Event: VERGE 2022 Date: Wednesday, October 26, 2022 Location: San Jose McEnery Convention Center, California

Overview

The presentation explored the concept of “carbon coin,” a theoretical new currency backed by central banks that organizations could earn by reducing or eliminating emissions. This idea, featured prominently in Kim Stanley Robinson’s novel “Ministry for the Future,” is transitioning from fiction to potential reality.

item.title: Introduction to Carbon Rewards
item.description:
Introduction

The carbon reward (XCR) is a new type of financial instrument that will be offered for mitigated carbon with aims to help manage anthropogenic carbon balance and avoid dangerous climate change.

Core Characteristics

Digital Asset Structure

  • Denoted as “XCR” and traded in foreign exchange markets
  • Backed by central banks and sovereign guarantees
  • Issued debt-free with long-term price floor support
  • Bankable but not a carbon credit or legal tender

Important Distinction

The XCR will be tradable, it is not a carbon credit and it cannot be used to offset carbon emissions.

item.title: Our Vision
item.description:
Our Vision

“Our vision is a world with a safe climate, together with healthy ecosystems, vibrant communities, and reliable clean energy.”

Three Strategic Pillars

1. Resolve

The organization aims to address the climate crisis through incentive-based mechanisms combining “carrot and stick” approaches for climate mitigation. This centers on a novel pricing theory for carbon and proposes carbon rewards to finance climate action and associated benefits.

2. Coordinate

The goal involves aligning governments, markets, and citizens toward collaborative climate management, ecosystem protection, and social advancement. This relies on establishing a global carbon reward marketplace and stakeholder engagement through reward weighting preferences.

item.title: SOCAP 2022
item.description:
Do we need a second economy for carbon? How to think like a plant

Event: SOCAP 2022 Date: October 18, 2022 Location: YBCA, San Francisco, California

Context

SOCAP convenes a diverse impact investing community focused on interconnected economic, social, and environmental systems. The organization emphasizes that “the climate crisis waits for no one and touches everyone.”

Key Participants

  • Moderator: Alexis Bunten (Co-Director, Bioneers Indigeneity Program)
  • Speaker: Dr. Delton Chen (Global Carbon Reward), described as a “civil engineer, geo-hydrologist” who originated the carbon currency concept referenced in the novel “The Ministry for the Future”

Main Theme

The presentation explores whether a parallel economic system centered on carbon mechanisms could support climate action and regenerative finance.

item.title: Our Mission
item.description:
Our Mission

“Our mission is to demonstrate and advocate a regenerative financial system that can advance a low-carbon transition while promoting ecological health, community wellbeing, and energy reliability.” (Updated January 18, 2025)

Four Core Tasks

The organization commits to completing these objectives:

  1. Establish demonstrations
  2. Manage operations
  3. Advocate the policy
  4. Propose a multilateral governance architecture

Detailed Focus Areas

Demonstrations

The organization prioritizes developing Global Carbon Reward showcases featuring diverse low-carbon technologies through public-private partnerships. These initiatives illustrate how governments can fund climate action without direct taxation and demonstrate how international cost-sharing conflicts can be resolved through a global climate mitigation services market. The demonstrations emphasize stakeholder consensus based on outcome ranking and financial incentives for improved people and planet results.

item.title: Hong Kong 2022
item.description:
Carbon Quantitative Easing - Club Breakfast

Event: FCC Hong Kong Club Breakfast Date: December 15, 2022, 8:30 AM – 10:00 AM Location: Foreign Correspondents Club, Hong Kong (Dining Room)

Key Details

Speaker: Dr. Delton Chen, Global Carbon Reward

  • Civil engineer and geo-hydrologist specializing in digital currency policy
  • Originated the “carbon currency” concept featured in the novel The Ministry for the Future

Moderator: Joe Pan, FCC Board of Governors Member

  • Blockchain and Web3 journalist (Chinese and English)
  • Co-founder of Carbon Neutral Club
  • Focuses on linking ESG metrics to digital assets

Content Highlights

The presentation centered on Carbon Quantitative Easing (CQE), a financial mechanism designed to address climate challenges through new digital currency approaches. The event positioned this as a solution for “gridlock to a regenerative financial system.”

item.title: Our Plan
item.description:
Our Plan

Our goal is to advocate and advance the Global Carbon Reward policy with our international partners, by demonstrating the policy’s capacity to incentivise a variety of climate mitigation methods and co-benefits, and the policy’s adaptability in diverse geographic settings.

Three Key Milestones

Partnering

The initial phase focuses on establishing collaborations with recognized NGOs and creating GCR think tanks across multiple countries. These think tanks will facilitate public-private partnerships involving governments, low-carbon technology firms, and nonprofit organizations with sponsorship arrangements.

item.title: Lund 2023
item.description:
What can be done to resolve the climate crisis?

Event: Lunch Seminar at Lund University Date: March 22, 2023 Location: International Institute for Industrial Environmental Economics (IIIEE), Lund University

Speaker

Delton Chen, Ph.D. - Founder & Project Director for Global Carbon Reward

Coordinator

Desirée Pettersson - Communications Specialist

Key Content Summary

The presentation introduces the Global Carbon Reward policy, developed over nine years. Chen discusses:

  • A “carbon pricing matrix” as a conceptual framework
  • Introduction of “systemic externality” - societal lock-in preventing conventional climate policies from being applied effectively
  • The need to price social costs and systemic risks separately using a “carrot and stick” approach
  • A proposed “parallel economy” and “carbon currency” designed to remove atmospheric GHGs and strategically reduce emissions

Organization

Global Carbon Reward operates under fiscal sponsorship by Inquiring Systems Inc., a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization.

item.title: Founder's Message
item.description:
Founder’s Message

“The Global Carbon Reward is a citizen-led initiative to protect the climate, communities and ecosystems.” — Dr. Delton Chen

Welcome

Dr. Delton Chen founded the Global Carbon Reward Initiative based on using a carbon reward (XCR) to mobilize climate action globally. According to the page, this instrument serves multiple purposes: economic stimulus, ecosystem service payments, and long-term investment. Crucially, the reward market differs from existing carbon markets because it avoids carbon offsetting entirely.

item.title: Ecocity 2023
item.description:
EcoCity World Summit 2023: Towards a Decarbonised Economy

Event: EcoCity World Summit 2023 Date: June 6, 2023 Location: Barbican Centre, London

Description

Dr. Delton Chen presented a new economic development framework called “optimal growth” (later rebranded as “balanced growth in carbon” for clarity). This approach combines innovative climate policy with a carbon currency mechanism designed to encourage collaborative efforts between governments and financial institutions in pursuing Paris climate accord targets.

item.title: Our Logo
item.description:
Our Logo

The official Global Carbon Reward emblem is provided above in scalable SVG format so you can reference it consistently across decks, presentations, and articles. Right-click/tap to download or open the file directly for inclusion in branding materials.

The Global Carbon Reward logo contains four major symbolic elements designed to represent the organization’s climate and economic mission.

Four Key Elements

1. The Letter “C”

Represents elemental carbon and symbolizes greenhouse gas mitigation rather than pollution. The blue color signifies “the Earth’s atmosphere during the day.”

item.title: Bard 2023
item.description:
Why ‘Carbon Rewards’ Should be Adopted to Resolve the Climate Crisis

Event: MBA Sustainability, Residency Weekend Date: October 7, 2023 Location: Bard College, New York

Description

item.title: Bank of England 2023
item.description:
Global Carbon Reward: International Policy for a New Carbon Asset

item.title: COP28 2023
item.description:
COP28 UAE | Global Carbon Reward

Event: COP28 UAE Date: November 30 - December 12, 2023 Location: Dubai, UAE

Overview

The Global Carbon Reward (GCR) initiative presented at three separate COP28 side events. The organization positioned their policy as addressing a critical gap in the COP28 climate roadmap by providing a scalable financial mechanism for clean energy transitions and atmospheric carbon removal.

Key Message

The page emphasizes that while COP28 called for transitioning away from fossil fuels, it lacked comprehensive financing solutions. The GCR framework proposes a novel reward system for mitigated carbon that incorporates central banking mandates while avoiding problematic offsetting practices.
